title.text: GETTING IDIOMS INTO A LEXICON BASED PARSERS HEAD

entities.text: INTO A LEXICON BASED PARSERS HEAD

abstractContent.text: An account is given of flexible idiom processing within a lexicon based parser.
The view is a compositional one.
The parser's behaviour is basically the "literal" one, unless a certain threshold is crossed by the weight of a particular idiom.
A new process will then be added.
The parser, besides yielding all idiomatic and literal interpretations embodies some claims of human processing simulation.
